meanings.definition: A substance added to a material to slow down a chemical reaction or process.
meanings.sent1: The construction workers used retarders to delay the drying of the concrete.
meanings.sent2: The painter added retarders to the paint to prevent it from drying too quickly.
meanings.sent3: The scientist accidentally spilled the retarders, causing the experiment to take longer than expected.
meanings.sent4: The chef used a special retarder in the dough to ensure the bread rose slowly and evenly.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic applied the retarders to the adhesive to give him more time to position the parts precisely.

meanings.definition: People or things that delay or hinder progress or development.
meanings.sent1: The protestors were seen as retarders of the city's growth by the local government.
meanings.sent2: The heavy traffic on the highway acted as a retarder for commuters trying to get to work.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel became a little retarder to the gardener's efforts to plant new flowers.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of failure was a mental retarder that held her back from pursuing her dreams.
meanings.sent5: The rainy weather served as a natural retarder to the outdoor event, causing delays in the schedule.
